definition: to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: In the past seven years, we've also seen images that have sobered us.
sentences.chinese: 在過去七年時間裏，我們也看到令人警醒的畫面。

sentences.english: Littleness and glory are the choices open to your striving and your vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 你究竟願爲卑微或爲榮耀而警醒奮鬥，完全操之於你。

sentences.english: The result is both realistic and hallucinatory.
sentences.chinese: 《和巴什爾跳華爾茲》也是警醒觀衆的噩夢。

sentences.english: Callista again stirred, after so long a slumber.
sentences.chinese: 卡莉斯塔在漫長的休眠後再次警醒。

sentences.english: At the same time I prescribed minor tranquillizers tolower her arousal levels.
sentences.chinese: 同時我給她開一些弱安定藥以降低她的警醒水平。

sentences.english: Hence, as the organizers explained, books burning of this time aimed to raise the social awareness, and declare war on "spirit rubbish".
sentences.chinese: 公開燒書就是爲了警醒社會，向“心靈垃圾”宣戰。
這個趨勢警醒了非科技類公司。

sentences.english: Her family can hand out all of her professional publications at the wake.
sentences.chinese: 這也警醒她的家人儘快整理出版她的專著。

sentences.english: He enjoined me to be alert all the way for fear to catch a cold at night.
sentences.chinese: 他囑我路上小心，夜裏要警醒些，不要受涼。

sentences.english: These examples are meant to caution you, not to deter you.
sentences.chinese: 這些例子是要你警醒，而非阻攔你。

sentences.english: YET EVEN IN his deathless state, the Emperor continues his eternal vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 即使在他的假死狀態中，帝皇的警醒亙古依然。

sentences.english: He then told me to be watchful all the time, and not catching cold at night.
sentences.chinese: 他囑咐我路上小心，夜裏要警醒些，不要受涼。

sentences.english: In an effort to stay alert, she drank several cups of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 在努力保持警醒的過程中，她喝了幾杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Watch ye therefore, for ye know not when the master of the house cometh.
sentences.chinese: 所以汝當警醒，因不知屋主何時到來。

sentences.english: Andy: "Watch ye, therefore, for ye know not when the master of the house cometh."
sentences.chinese: 所以汝當警醒，因不知屋主何時到來。

sentences.english: Besides, the pastors of the Church are here reminded of their duty.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，這裏也提醒教會的牧師們警醒。

definition: to think back over sth/to review/to revisit/to rethink/reflection/reassessment
to think of danger in times of safety/to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)
to reflect upon oneself/to examine one's conscience/to question oneself/to search one's soul
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
to realize suddenly/to wake up to the truth/to suddenly awake from sleep
lit. the cart in front overturns, a warning to the following cart (idiom); fig. draw lesson from the failure of one's predecessor/learn from past mistake/once bitten twice shy
pinyin: qian2 che1 zhi1 fu4 , hou4 che1 zhi1 jian4

definition: to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
